llm.feedback:
Strong foundation and ambitious scope, but the draft fails the strict Swing Trade format and drifts into narrative clutter. Actionable edits to lift to world-class:

- Enforce the exact four-line Mover & Scenarios format: only two Up and two Down, each line: Up|Time window|Driver/Mechanism|What to watch|Probability% (with in-text IDs only after the facts/numbers). Currently you have two Up and two Down but the windows are nonstandard and the lines blend base-case, alt-paths, and longer prose. Choose crisp, non-overlapping windows (e.g., Up | 0–6 months; Up | 6–12 months; Down | 0–6 months; Down | 6–12 months) and keep each line to the four fields only.
- Tighten drivers to first-principles and clear catalysts: Up lines should hinge on (i) Regime A’s tech/moat earnings transmission and cloud/AI momentum; (ii) Alt-path 2’s accelerated AI adoption and policy breakthroughs; Down lines on (i) Regime B/C inflation/policy headwinds; (ii) Regime-shift risk signals (tariffs, regulatory probes). Distill to 1–2 concise bullets per line, not paragraphs.
- Anchor probabilities to concrete material evidence and cite only IDs after each numeric or claim: e.g., “Azure growth ~39%” (0G3A676BP)(48JXC9VDP); “GMV around $163B; GMV growth ~27%; revenue ~29%” (QF)(0G3A676BP); “tariff-driven inflation pressures” (IGP1Q4ZEJ)(YVQU6QCY4). Avoid multi-source rambling in a single line; place citations only after facts, not after every clause.
- Prune and standardize “What to watch”: compress to 1–2 precise watch-items per line (e.g., catalyst/trigger + primary risk or invalidation signal). If you cite FDA/Medicare milestones, tie them to a clear timeframe (e.g., “HeartSciences FDA decision by 2026” if supported).
- Clarify and separate the Swing Trade plan from the Mover lines: the Swing Trade section must be a single MSFT tradable line with the required fields (Direction | Horizon | Entry | Stop | Target | R/R | Invalidation | Trigger | Probability % | Confidence). If MSFT is the chosen tradable, specify concrete levels or rules (e.g., Entry near current price, Stop at X% below 50-day MA; Target Y%; R/R; Invalidation by a break below the 50- or 200-day MA; Trigger: breakout above a multi-week high). Ensure you present only one clean Swing Trade line (or two, but within the 1–2-line limit) and keep the rest as the 4-line Mover/Outlook content.
- Reconcile conflicts and remove nonessential anchors: the draft drifts between private-market components, private-liquidity narratives, and public-earnings mechanics. Pick a single coherent base-case (Regime A) and one distinct alt-path (Alt path 2) with quantified catalysts; keep the rest as conditional watch signals rather than separate lines.
- Improve scenario structure and invalidation tests: add explicit, testable inflection points (e.g., if AI-adoption tempo fails to accelerate by a stated delta by a date, shift from Regime A to Regime B; if tariff announcements lift CPI beyond a threshold, reprice discount rates) with concrete thresholds drawn from the material where possible (e.g., tariff/price pressure channel; DOJ/regulatory risk signals on UNH/LULU).
- Clean up numerics and avoid implausible or unsupported figures: only keep numbers that have a clear source in the material; remove or reframe any “implausible” figures (e.g., avoid asserting absolute contracted revenue figures unless they’re sourced) and annotate what is relied upon.
- Citations discipline: ensure every numeric or assertion that relies on the material carries an ID; keep IDs only after the fact, not sprinkled through prose; no trailing or separate references section in the feedback block (the output requires IDs only where facts are asserted).
- If you keep Range/Range-like private-market references, bound them to one line (Alt path) and ensure they don’t leak into the core Up/Down lines; otherwise rephrase as macro-risk/watch signals tied to the regime framework.

In short, convert to a clean 4-line Swing Trader Mover block with two Up and two Down, each line tightly focused on a single mechanism and a single, evidence-backed probability; replace the longer synthesis with a single crisp tradable-outlook line (MSFT) that adheres to the requested fields; ground every claim in the IDs after numbers; and fix formatting to ensure strict compliance with the instruction set.
